page.title: 05HOUSING - continued
page.content: HOUSING - continued... from local clay pit. Vicarage 1856, older houses of few repaired partly with brick (the Hall) and windows replaced by Georgian and later Victorian ones, roof formally stone and thatch by tile and slate. 1900's - First programme of local authority housing in 1930, Council Square followed by Greenway 1946, Field End 1967 and Old People's Bungalows 1977. 1960 & 70's houses & bungalows built in contemporary style but since Brassingtons inclusion in conversation area new dwellings must be stone clad and have roof camber 6 windows in 16th Century style. Building (in filling) between existing houses within the village boundary only is now allowed in order to avoid "ribbon" building in the countryside.
